newsitem.title: USA: Lott -- favorable chances for balanced budget.
newsitem.headline: Lott -- favorable chances for balanced budget.

text.p: Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott, Republican of Mississippi, said Monday the chances of reaching a balanced budget agreement with the White House this year are "certainly way above 50 percent."

Interviewed by the CNBC network, Lott also said there was some common ground for negotiations with President Clinton on tax cuts. "We are talking in the same areas so maybe we can come together," he said.
Clinton's plan includes $98 billion in tax cuts over five years while Republicans are seeking $173 billion with a broader capital gains rate cut.
